dublinCore.dc:title: 119 SJ 33 IS: Providing for congressional disapproval of the proposed foreign military sale to the Government of Israel of certain defense articles and services.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Sanders introduced the following joint resolution; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: Providing for congressional disapproval of the proposed foreign military sale to the Government of Israel of certain defense articles and services.

section.text: That the following proposed foreign military sale to the Government of Israel is prohibited:

paragraph.text: The sale of the following defense articles and services described in Transmittal No. 25–34, submitted to Congress pursuant to section 36(b)(1) of the Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2776(b)(1)), and published in the Congressional Record on March 3, 2025: The following Major Defense Equipment (MDE): Thirty-five thousand five hundred twenty nine (35,529) MK 84 or BLU–117 General Purpose (GP) bomb bodies, or a combination of both. Four thousand (4,000) I–2000 Penetrator warheads. The following non-MDE items will also be included: spare parts, consumables, accessories, and repair and return support; transportation support; U.S. Government and contractor engineering, technical, and logistics support services; and other related elements of logistics and program support.
